quack.title: Keyboard shortcuts
quack.text: Actually, they're not really shortcuts. They're the way you use Quill!
quack.heading: Formatting
quack.text: Different semantic markup can be applied. The various formats can be applied by typing Ctrl+Shift+<Key>.

You can never get away from legacy, so bold and italics are Ctrl+B and Ctrl+I respectively. It's not like we were going to use those combinations for something else, and as much as consistency is important, we're not trying to make people's lives difficult.

Ultimately the point is to ensure consistent display of the resultant markup. You don't need an Inline for bloody every last thing under the sun. People will doubtless rant on about how they're favourite thing isn't available. [Last week it was someone complaining that there wasn't a strong semantic for ship names, and that as a result she couldn't say "USS Enterprise" consistently. Yeah. Sorry about that. Really] But you have a fair range to choose from and if you are desperate you can always hack your RenderEngine to do something different. Remember that the point is to ensure consistent display of different classes of text; the person who wanted ship names in italics can just use <publication> to get herself italics.
